Google.text:
My first review is pretty ancient and thought it required updating especially since they have a new location. The new location is very nice and is much more modern to their old location.

First things first, don’t forget this place is CASH ONLY. The service still isn’t the greatest. The staff isn’t very friendly and rarely do you see anyone smile there, but hey, we know why we all come here… THE SOUP DUMPLINGS. My favorite is the pork dumplings. If you really like crab, you’ll enjoy the crab ones. They have a hint of a seafood taste, but I prefer sticking to the pork.

We wanted honey chicken, but they don’t have that so we got the sweet and sour chicken. Portion size was pretty small. It was not even close to being worth $21. It’s more sour than sweet. We were told it came with rice, but we had to flag someone down to ask for rice and they brought this time little portion that is not a shareable portion. I wasn’t a big fan; would have preferred another order of dumplings instead.

A lot of first timers come here and I noticed they have no idea how to eat the dumplings. I educated the table next to me as I noticed they were trying to look over to see how it was done.

I thought this little verbal tutorial might help:
(Check out my photos to see the examples numbered for this description)

1. Use the tongs to gently grab the dumpling at the very top. If you are too rough, it could pierce and cause you to lose your soup.
3. Place dumpling on your mini soup spoon.
4. Bite a tiny hole near the top.
5. Use chopsticks to hold the dumpling up while you drink the soup then devour.
✅If your plate looks like this in the end, great success!
❌FAIL.

PS: Careful eating your first dumpling. They are extremely hot when they come to the table. Give it a min or two to cool down. Hope this was helpful. Enjoy!

Always packed, but there's a reason for that.  GREAT FOOD!!!.  When me and wife disagree about what to have for dinner, we always end up at Joe's.  And they have the best soup dumplings on the planet.  And I've been to Shanghai to have their "allegedly" best.  Not even close.  Joe's the best.

Typically I have to avoid most Asian food when I am eating out, as I have a major nut allergy. However, luckily here they were able to accomodate me! I ended up trying the shredded beef with noodles, and it was absolutely delicious! I would've ordered more and stayed longer if I wasn't there with a big group of people. The food was great and would definitely recommend!

This has been my favorite meal of New York.  We had a wait for our table of 6, but it was worth it.  Everything was served family style.  The General Tso's Chicken was some of the best I've ever eaten.  We also tried each soup dumpling.  The pork soup dumpling was my favorite.  The crispy pan fried noodle was something I've never had, but it was so flavorful.  Food came really quickly.  I can't wait to get back!

It's cash only. And you can't place a reservation. Waiting time is about 30 min. However the pork soup dumplings are just amazing and you should at least have some to share. Everything is good and cooked fresh.  This is a must try when you are in Chinatown!

Yelp.text: 非常好吃！  we loved the food. It's authentic and delicious.  We will come back. Also our waiter terry is sweet.
Delicious food! We ate here multiple times during our visit to NYC. A few of our favorite dishes - the smoked hunan bacon with dried turnips, mala dry pot,...
Best hunan restaurant in the city. Great choices of speaciality dishes and cocktails. The server(Terry) is so caring. Recommend!!

Google.text: Beware if you don't eat pork meat or read Chinese. Online menu does not indicate in English that noodle dishes contain pork meat. We received 2 orders with meat. We called to explain that we ordered off the online menu. The receptionist said "meat" is on the menu in Chinese. She said they could have sent another order without meat but the kitchen had just closed. She said they will refund the order, but 3 weeks later the refund has not appeared on statement. We ended up calling Tao restaurant and paid for a meatless order to be delivered.

Really enjoyed the food here! We had the beef stew, pork soup dumplings, seafood fried rice and stir fried cauliflower. We really enjoyed everything but the beef stew was standout - different to what we expected but so flavourful! We probably ordered a bit too much for two people but there wasn’t anything we would have wanted to have not ordered in hindsight.

Great ,consistent restaurant with good food and lovely atmosphere.
Every time we’re in a group, in midtown and craving Chinese we always end up back here:)

They also have a decent lunch set for one person, but I strongly recommend coming as a group and ordering a la carte for much better variety and because its the perfect place to share a lot of stuff and try different dishes.

Cocktails are good but can be too sweet! Ask to adjust accordingly

Food 5/5
Authentic dishes that satisfied my craving for Chinese food. A very nicely curated menu, with everything that I used to eat in my childhood. The Peking duck, pea shoots, Grandma's braised pork, thousand year egg, husband and wife cold dish, and wood ear cold dish.

Atmosphere 5/5
Absolutely love the interior design and lighting of this place, super cool and graceful Chinese vibes.

Service 4/5
They were accommodating for our huge party of 15, but because they were lacking chairs, we had to wait a while before our entire group could get seated, despite arriving even a bit early for our reservation. Because they don't have a table for groups larger than around 12, the table was a little squished for us, and the extra chairs they brought up were foldable ones.

Food is maybe a 3/10. Some dishes were hit or miss, not very authentic. Overly expensive and nothing came in a timely fashion. Tried to kick us out an hour before another reservation, when they still didn't bring us all the food or drinks. Tried to force us to pay more tip, although we paid what we thought was decent for this (18%). Definitely try other places then this. Some positives were the waiters and the decor.

Google.text: The food was great! I liked the shredded pork with bamboo shoots. Google.text: Great for a group as you can share a lot of things, but also great for 2 or 3 people. Ambiance and service we're excellent. On Lunar New Year Eve, I wanted to book Lunar New Year dinner for a party of 7,  but nothing was showing as available online and couldn't reach anyone over the phone... Decided to go in person the day right when they opened for lunch of to try my luck...special kudos to the hostess (unfortunately didn't catch her name) who not only managed to carve out a spot for us within the time range that worked for us, but put us in a beautiful private dining room on the second floor which was totally unexpected! Had a space to even hang up coats and store bags.

Additional special kudos to our server Alex who was super helpful and proactive - we had a couple folks who accidentally dropped their chopsticks on the floor, and before we even had a chance to ask Alex for replacements, he already came by with new ones!

Apart from the great service, you probably care more about the food...we literally ordered almost half the entire menu. Everything was great! I particularly liked the Spicy Soft Shell Crabs and the Curiously Tasty Chicken, but everything was great, and everyone liked everything.

They have their liquor license now too! Great times all around! Highly recommended, even if you're not in the area. Cheers

Delicious. Perfect spot to go for Chinese dishes on a cold, snowy Sunday afternoon. The ambience is elegant, dim and great for dates or meeting with friends. The service was difficult to find at times, staffing was definitely not an issue, it just seemed that they were not as aware or as attentive. The dishes themselves were delicious. The tea soaked duck however, was barely edible as almost the entire dish was fat. I love the skin, but when the fat is accounting for 75% of the actual dish, it becomes sickening to eat any more than three bites. The drinks are strong, but for the $15 price, I’d expect some type of garnish, not foam from the ice shaker or small bits of ice leftover.

Google.text: Delicious, authentic food and amazing service. This was my first experience eating indoors in over two years, and it was lovely. We made a reservation and were greeted by name upon entry. All staff were properly masked and our vaccination cards were checked. My friend is vegan and there were several options. We shared the cold tofu appetizer with celery shoots (scrumptious! See photo), and she had spicy green beans. I enjoyed pork and bamboo shoots, and we tried purple rice. The food was so very reminiscent of my Chinese father's cooking. The staff was attentive - even cleaning the table when we spilled some. Very clean and spacious, lovely decor, with an exceptionally clean bathroom. Truly wonderful experience all around. I believe 美麗 translates to beautiful, and that is exactly what this restaurant is.

Google.text:
4/16 Visit Update
Almost a year after the pandemic hit, Wah Fung is still as popular as ever. The crowds and line have returned with hungry people waiting patiently almost a 1/2 hr. to get their roast pork, chicken, duck fix. The signature roast pork over rice is still juicy, tasty with just enough fattiness. If you are willing to line up, a roast pork over rice is waiting.

Chinese version of fast food.  Delicious roast pork and barbecue pig over rice at ridiculously cheap prices. These are the signature meats and what Wah Fung is known for. Pass on the roast chicken and duck, good but not extraordinary. Tiny storefront, takeout only. Single line to order that always go out the door and sometimes down the block. They  sell out of items late in the day.

Great tasting affordable Chinese fast food.  A staple Chinese food spot o. Chrystie St. for years...  The menu is limited, so the choices are few.  White rice, steamed cabbage and your choice of chicken,  roast pork, or duck.  $5 for small, $7 for large and there a generous portion of meat given.  Expect to stand on the out the door line since it's no secret anymore.

I'm sure the pandemic has taken a toll on Wah Fung in some way, but it's lost 2 stars from me on this visit. Last Sunday I got in line just as it opened the door at 9 am. I was the fifth in line.  I noticed it was a lady instead of 2 men as I remembered manning the cutting board.  And for 15 whole minutes she did not serve one single person, just keep cutting and moving meats. The line was like 12 people by now and everyone was really annoyed; me especially because my wife was waiting in the car which was in a "temporary" spot. When the line finally started moving, it was still much slower than I had remembered because it was now a one-man operation. I ended up spending 30 minutes waiting before I finally get to order my duck lunchboxes. In retrospect, I figured the man must have been late and the lady was just buying time help getting thing ready.

In exchange for the long wait was not fruition but even more disappointments. The large size boxes that I ordered were now more like 90 part white rice, 5 part cabbage, and 5 part duck.  And aside from the drum piece, the duck was essentially fat and bones, and it was not flavorful nor savory to go with any rice.  In the end I'm left with a gross amount of rice with nothing to go with it.  OK, the price may have only gone up by $1.25 but the quality and value had gone down the drain.

If I do come back at all, the only thing I'll get would be the BBQ pork.  At least it's boneless and it would go with rice much better than the pathetic duck they served me on this visit.

This place sales roast pork, roast duck, chicken and a few other things. It always has a line. I've visit this place only when the line is short. Their food is great and they definitely have the secret sauce. I recommend getting roast pork. It's just mouth watering good.

The issue from observation from years of visiting this place is that there's only one person chopping the meat and handling the cash. Lately, there's finally someone collecting the cash after the items are boxed. That still leaves 90% of the work to one person that's overworked when servicing customers.

What the owner needs is more people streamlining the chopping and packaging. Why can't the cashier also fill boxes with rice for those ordering? And for the person chopping, it's a damn hard job to do all day with something razor sharp butcher knife and it is heavy. If they bought an automated chopper, the line would move so much faster and they'd make so much more money while at it for a few person operation. We all want to see this place grow in volume and thrive. Their growth has been stagnant since the dawn of time. And while this isn't somewhat foreseeable in the future, those $2.50 mini lunch boxes were such a hit, I'd want that coming back some day. It's a quick meal it's always been filling to keep me going when I pass by.

Don't be intimidated by the line! It moves very quickly so know what you want and have your cash ready 💸! It is MOST definitely worth the wait! Amazing quality, portions and prices! But go early if you want the duck because they will run out. Their roast pig is so juicy, there's a perfect amount of fat and the skin is cracklin'! The most I've paid for a Large Combo is $11 which included, at least, a quarter duck but most everything else is $4.75-$9. The regular single portions at around $5 is more than enough for 2 to share 🎎! There's no sit down/eat in, hence the line.

I have had a lot of great Chinese food in my time. But Shanghai 21 has topped the list for taste and quality. I recommend getting there by 5:00-5:30pm so you don't have to wait for a table. We left at 6:30pm and the line to get in was out the door and down the sidewalk. The vegetable spring rolls were out of this world.

I placed a takeout order. The person on the phone spoke very good and clear English. I was told ten minutes and I was about that far away. The order was packed and ready to go even before I arrived.

I was told that this restaurant  specializes in Mandarin/Northern China 🇨🇳 cuisine.

I ordered:
Kau Pu, a vegetarian appetizer,
Squid with Cabbage over rice,
Steamed pork rolls.

Everything was cooked to perfection.

If you like Northern Chinese / Mandarin style food, you must make this restaurant a part of your itinerary when in Manhattan,  NYC.

Overall 5/5: We grabbed this on the way to the airport and y'all im obsessed.

Food 5/5: The dumplings were awesome. We tried a good mix of them, we had the crab and pork soup dumplings, soup dumplings with truffle and pork, and the pan fried pork dumplings (my favorite of these). All of them were superb though!

Service 5/5: We only did take out, but the food came out fast and it was super easy to order. It was so packed on like an hour wait but i can see why that was the case.

Thank you, Shanghai 21!

Google.text: First of all, OH…..MY…..GOODNESS!! Every member of staff in this restaurant is top notch. They create a calm, inviting environment as soon as you enter. We had the Rubirosa which I thought was good, and the spicy honey (too sweet with no other flavor to cut through it), which I was not a fan of, though 1/3 of our party enjoyed it. I normally wouldn't take a star off for that - maybe that's just me ordering the wrong thing - but the combination of the other pizza only being "good" plus the above average price just made it not worth it for me.

The best pizza on earth. So good i named my dog after it. I make the pilgrimage at least once a year and go to Rubirosa 2-3x when I’m in the city. Personal favorites: Caesar salad, Rubirosa supreme, cheesecake. But then again, I haven’t had the whole menu yet. Go here. Go here multiple times. Eat everything.

I'm obsessed with Rubirosa Pizza!

My friend who lives locally recommended this place to be us and we thoroughly enjoyed our experience! We came on a busy Saturday afternoon and we were lucky to snag a table for 4 upon walking in.

We tried their Italian Wedding Soup, Octopus, Vodka Pizza, and Bianca Pizza. The soup was rich and so very comforting on a cool autumn day. The octopus was reminiscent of grilled octopus like they make it in Italy, and it was perfectly cooked!

The pizza, however, was the best part! I loved both pies but the Vodka Pizza was my favorite. The sauce was amazing and cheesy. The Bianca Pizza was great as well! It was very creamy, luscious, and everything you want in a white pizza.

Service was great although the restaurant was busy! Would absolutely return!

Google.text: I lived in NYC when Supper opened nearly 20 years ago, and it became a favorite back then. The neighborhood was very different, but this restaurant has survived. That does not surprise me, because their food is simple, yet delicious. The prices are higher today, of course, but my go-to dish is still on the (Specials) menu--the Veal Milanese--and it is worth every penny. I remember when it was on the original menu, and it read something like "served with a nice little salad," and it still is. The veal is lightly breaded, quickly fried in butter in a pan on the stove (I sat at the bar and watched them make it). It is plated next to the salad, which is indeed simple but a perfect accompaniment, along with half a lemon to squeeze over everything. It's fun to do, and I tend to use every drop. This dish could be a "last meal" dish for me, I love it that much, even well over a decade since I first had it. Also see the photo of the bread with the white beans in oil. Not enough places start with a thoughtful complimentary starter (or anything complementary at all), but they do. And it's tasty. As long as Supper is still around, it's worth me trekking there whenever I visit New York. And one other thing to mention, considering so many places have gone to card-only, this place has stuck to the CASH ONLY format (they have their own ATM in the back).
Italians food + migos/Travis Scott sound track = 👍👍👍👍👍

What an amazing experience. Starting with the staff. Everyone is lovely, warm, hospitable. Service is 10/10 - unmatched. Turns out they are more than just coworkers, most of the staff has been here >10 years and are truly a family. Onto the food. Delicious. So good. The pasta tasted so fresh and was seasoned perfectly. Great wine menu and lovely ambiance. Overall wonderful night. Would highly recommend!!

Great hand rolls and creative sushi!

As a Michelin recommended restaurant, the food here is good as expected.
The hand rolls and sushi here are rather fusion and creative, the combination between fruits and sushi/hand roll is really special.

Google.text: Only place I ordered pad Thai again. But the food is really really good. From the first bite to the last it was so good and fresh. Thep New York City is one of the best Thai restaurants that I’ve been too, and New York City is filled with them! Their food matches the looks, with each dish looking very appetizing. Nonetheless, the food in itself is quite delicious, a nice mixture of flavors. Definitely recommend!

EDIT:

Entree, main course, half bottle of sake 60$ in upper east side. Not bad.

Google.text: This place is amazing! The food is so delicious and everyone here is so welcoming and nice. We started off with some Thai iced tea which was so delicious!! Then we got the app platter where you get to choose 3 different appetizers! Then we all got different dishes: Basil Noodles with Steak, Basil Noodles with Steak & Duck, and Spicy Basil Rice with chicken! Everything is so yummy and pleasing!

Ordered Thai Black Pepper chicken and it was very good. We asked for mild as one in our party can't do spicy food, and it was still full of flavor which isn't always the case at other places. The Thai fried rice were great too - both with chicken and steak.

Not often to I leave a 10/10 review, but top Thai deserves this. Thank you Tarn for the incredible service. The starters were so scrumptious and full of flavour. The mains: the steak melted in your mouth and the duck was just perfect. Even better that’s it’s 100% halal.

The food was real good, however the service needs improvement.

I chose this place to eat at because my friend who was visiting from the south only eats Halal food. He arrived at the restaurant earlier than me. When he went inside the server made him wait outside in the cold rain before being seated. This is understandable as there is not much indoor seating as is. However, the server did not let him touch the heater.

When I arrived and we sat down the server visited us twice between a few minutes to take our order. We felt rushed that we needed to choose as if they wanted us to order food, eat, and get out so the next customer could come.

At the end of our meal, I paid for both of our meals as a courteous host would do for a good friend they haven't seen in a long time. After I signed the receipt, I wasn't mindful of the "Suggested" percentage of the tip as I was talking to my friend. However at the point, I also didn't believe service was worthy of a great tip. Another server came back to our table and asked me why I didn't tip the "Suggested" amount. I was phased out because that has never happened to me and I wouldn't be surprised if the server had done that to other customers as well. I told her I was a student and she proceeded to say, "we make a living off of this." I understand this because I too was once a host at a restaurant. However, the way the server handled the situation was not appropriate. I was insulted in front my of my visiting friend who ended up paying a $10 bill to make them happy. It was very embarrassing for me in front of my visiting friend who is also a student.

The management should know that they are near a university where many students don't have that much money to spend and if the servers are not making enough in tips then the management should pay their servers more otherwise the servers should leave and find a better paying position. Based on the amount of good reviews the restaurant has, it should be making well and if not, then fix the service. Good restaurant businesses are honest, pay their servers well, teach their waiters to be kind and friendly and also let people enjoy their meal. I also don't know how credible the "Halal" sticker is. This place serves alcohol and true halal places don't. If the food truly isn't from a halal supplier then management should be ashamed for tricking so many people only to get more business. Dishonesty always fails.

This Thai restaurant is a favorite among the many options available. It's always delicious cooked with everything fresh. Try the noodles, sauté, or curry, you can't go wrong! The staff is also friendly and they provide quick service. I highly recommend this spot!

Google.text: I was in the neighborhood and I was in the mood for some Asian Cuisine. And from reading all the positive reviews I decided to go to Thai Holic! I ordered two different hot soups on a cold New York day! The coconut and the Tom Yum (yummy) soup. Not only did this place meet my standards but it also exceeded my expectations! Both soup tasted so good that I couldn't dare to put any hot sauce because it was excellent as it was! Then I suddenly noticed the biggest pieces of shrimp I have ever seen! You can't ask for anything more, soups that are delicious and are also healthy for you too!! Thank you and I look forward stopping by again!!!

Just a well rounded Thai spot. If you are looking at the intersection of price and value, you’ve found it.  The service is great and the food’s high quality.  The decor and ambience  are modest and relaxed.  Couldn’t really ask for more (also they have a much appreciated heavy handed pour on the wine glasses ;)

So good!! Spice level is on point for the Spicy Holic Noodles and the Basil Fried Rice. Flavors are great, quantity is plentiful. I got delivery and will definitely be adding this spot into the rotation.
This place is a true gem! The value you get is amazing. I highly recommend the green curry. If you are looking for a cute and chill place to grab dinner, look no further.
Best Thai in Brooklyn. The service is amazing and it’s so cozy inside. I’ve never had a bad item especially takeout. Everything is fresh and cooked quickly.

Lots of friends recommended this halal Thai restaurant to me & I had to try it out. I loved the restaurant a lot, stuff were very nice. Restroom were very clean & decorated real rice. Now comes the food part; I ordered 1 snack, 1 tea, 1 dish 1 dessert. Bill came to more then 50$ for one person that’s real expensive! One thing I have to say is that the dessert I tried was fried ice-cream & worse one I ever had. After only 1 bite I had to return it back. 15$ just went to trash, they also didn’t offer me anything else or asked if I want anything else on the house. That’s what they supposed to do. That’s a bummer! Besides the ice-cream I actually enjoyed the rest of my food. But only because the price is high I am not gonna probably come that often.
Another thing I have to say is that like all the other Asian places where after you say something they talk in their language & you feel like they r talking about u. I feel like they should always talk in English, especially when they r fluent in it. It made me very uncomfortable! I m pretty sure lots of people will know what I meant .

Google.text: Authentic, delicious, and addicting!! I try to avoid going to the same restaurant too often in the City because there’s soo much to try, but the place is too good. The balance of savory, sweet, and umami is perfect. Highly recommended to all in the area.

Service was good and must have the Thai tea!

Boran is a great and authentic Thai restaurant in Brooklyn. All dishes are served in a very unique way of the fine dining.
Food: Very selective menu serves in a very fine dining style. Taste is really authentic Thai cuisine. All dishes are neat and served in right portion.
Service: Staff are attentive and provide very comfort atmosphere. Great service.
Price: Reasonable comparing with the quality of food, portion size and fine-dining style.

However, the down point is that you might have to wait for food a bit longer than usual because they will prepare food portion by portion, order by order with very as a fine-dining.

Also, the restaurant is quite busy after 6pm for dinner. You may have to be on the wait-list but you will be compensated by the great food and services.

I would absolutely recommend Boran Thai Restaurant to my friends and network when they are in town.
I come here every time I’m on this side of town, never disappoints!
Very authentic Thai made with great ingredients. Unique dishes from regions made by chef who lived in Thailand. They would have gotten five but the crispy duck basil was a bit dry.

Google.text: My mom is from Thailand and I must admit, Somtum Der is my favorite spot in NYC. I could eat here every week. All of their PAPAYA SALADS, larb, and raw shrimp are delicious and SPICY. I really like their soups too but they may be a bit too herbal for some! I haven't had the rice or noodle dishes that you usually find at Thai restaurants because their other dishes are so good.

The flavor is real, and finally a place in New York that has a legit spice level. I'm definitely coming back at the next opportunity. Also, I'm a huge larb fan, and that seems to be one of their specialties!

Fantastic papaya salad. Nice service.

Updated: hands down - best Thai place in the US I've been.

Cool and chill vibes of restaurant. Pad thai is a bit spicy compared to other Thai restaurants in NY, tho it tastes still good. FYI, it is a little bit pricey in terms of the presentation of dish and interior.

Google.text: One of those hole is the wall places that doesn't really look like much at first, but my friends and I were just looking for some cheap dumplings late at night after a show. I got the curry soup, which came  fast and in take out container, which for some reason made me really happy to be back home in New York. Let me tell you, this little soup really did not disappoint. It was bursting with flavor, had good amounts of tofu and chicken, and was just spicy enough. Highly recommend and will definitely will be going back.
Peter the owner is a wonderful host. The food was delicious and staff and super friendly. We had our little two year old with us and she had a great time too. Good food for kids too.

I love mom and pop outfits. The gentleman at the counter came quickly to check our vaccine cards and to seat us. The chef whipped us our Pad See Ew and Pad Thai in record time, and you know what? It was the best tasting Thai food we have had in a long, long time.
We had the Pad Thai, vermicelli noodles, and grilled chicken with rice and all of it was delicious! Also the service was excellent and the prices were very reasonable. Highly recommend.

Love Mama has a good amount of variety without sacrificing quality. This place is great for groups that want options. Our group was traveling to New York and just wanted a taste of our own Mama's cooking back home and this restaurant delivered with their Malaysian/Indonesian food. The customer service is great and the owner even went out of his way to accommodate us.

I really want to go back there again once I visit Dumbo or Brooklyn!

Em is a true gem! We walked over the Brooklyn Bridge from Manhattan, and my son picked this place to eat. We were greeted with a friendly smile after the lunch rush, and we picked our own table. We ordered the spring rolls, and they were hot, crispy, and delicious! I had a pork bowl, my husband had the beef pho, my son had the chicken pho, and my daughter had a chicken bowl. Everything was so fresh and bright, the beef was delectable, the pork was flavorful and tender. Just everything we ate was pretty perfect and very reasonably priced. This may not seem like a big deal, but the bathroom was the cleanest and best cared for I have since since we got the NY. It was an easy walk from the bridge, and the interior decor had a very calming vibe. Highly recommend!

It was served with an avocado dipping sauce which worked perfectly.  My lemon grass pork bun was wonderful with a slight char to the fat on the pork and the rest of the pork super tender.  The other dishes we ordered were equally tasty, a traditional bang mi sandwich and the combination bun bowl.

Waitress was genuine and kind despite our late start we were never rushed. Felt like we owned the restaurant as we dined outside and no one else there. Highly recommend.

The food was extremely good and the staff very helpful. There is a full outdoor seating area available and the restaurant is making efforts to eliminate any possibility of spread and alleviate concerns. I'm visiting from out of town but will absolutely return when in the city again!

Google.text: This place is a gem! I went here with my mother before a concert and they were exceptionally speedy to make sure we got to the show on time. We tried their dip sampler and they all were delicious. The grilled octopus was spectacular as well as the meatballs. I would recommend trying anything on the menu! As well as the drinks. They were so tasty and helped make the meal complete

Went, invited by my son, William E. for food. The attention was excellent. The food was excellent. I liked it, hopefully plan to go back. The place was also very nice. Very clean ! You must try their 5 different types of humus and tzakiti spread....delicious !

Went here a couple weeks ago with my mom and loved that their kitchen is open so late! We enjoyed the festive atmosphere, the music was upbeat but not too loud, and our server was very friendly. My mom ordered the best dish which was the Moussaka. Mine was good but basically cheese and meat, not very complex or anything. The food was good, nothing particularly outstanding but it hit the spot. This is a good choice if you’re in the area, it’s bit late, and you want a satisfying meal!

My boyfriend and I have been here twice in the past week because the food is authentic, delicious, and the staff very nice. This will be our go-to place since we just moved to the neighborhood.  We brought his Greek family here and they approved. Amazing happy hour deals as well. Best spanakopita I have ever had.
Hugo is amazing. He can make a great drink.  Try the Greek gyro platter. Highlights: calamari was amazing. Not chewy nor overcooked. Salmon and spinach and rice was fresh.

We eat here at least once a week. LOVE the imaginative Latino menu. The quality is top notch and priced considerably lower than any Greek diner in the hood.
It’s Service with a smile.
Just make sure your party arrives all at the same time so they will seat you. Even at peak times, the wait is never more than 20 minutes.

UPDATE during the Pandemic... 2021 and this place still rocks. Food is consistently good at any meal and very affordable which is important to me. The staff here treats you like family even after a long absence.

My partner and I started coming here after moving to Chelsea in June. The food is delicious, but the STAFF is why we continue to come back. Both Jennifer and Pedro offer consistently exceptional service. They've remembered our orders and our faces since the first time we came in. Pedro always greets with a smile and has such a lovely sense of humor and Jessica has an equally warm affect and is a wonderful conversationalist. Would recommend to ANYONE looking for a great brunch spot in Chelsea on a budget. The Copellia crew will make you feel a part of their family. Well worth every penny spent!

Been dining here regularly for almost 10 years. Food is fantastic, but what's more is the service from Pedro and the amazing staff! I think Pedro might be the most pleasant person in all of NYC!! Always a smile, even the mask can't hide, and he treats his customers as if they were family! I've never seen the man have an off day, which is why I felt it was so important to recognize with a review! (I never do reviews). ¡Gracias!

Good food and cozy. The price is fairly reasonable, the location is great for me ans the service is friendly. Don't order coffee though. I think that they charge too much for that especially this is not their specialty.

Pedro ruined our experience and will not go back unless he is gone.

Google.text: Great place to meet. Plenty of room to eat and have a meeting. Loved the ambiancebut would have liked more light on my food. When the food is this good and well-prepared, it is nice to see it in allies visual glory. The fish tacos were a heavenly surprise.

I'm definitely coming here again! Randomly went here with my girls for a few birthday drinks and snacks! Please do make a reservation of you have a large party (5 or more people). Rather be safe than sorry just in case, as this seems to be a fairly popular restaurant. Weekends during the winter may get a little crowded, although they do have seating outside (would probably only recommend during the Summer). Staff were accommodating and friendly, made some great suggestions for drinks, and treated us to a round of shots (for the birthday girls ;) )! They also have brunch drink specials (Monday through Thursday, 4-10pm, Saturday and Sunday 12-4pm)! I loved the indoor decor, feels very intimate and cozy! If you love Mexican, I'd definitely recommend giving them a try! Drinks aren't too bad price wise, if you enjoy brunch... They have a variety of options that include prosecco! Their appetizers and entrees are fairly priced as well.

The vibe is cool.  The ambience is nice. It's a good place for friends or a date. I had the salmon with the naked sweet potatoes and asparagus.  It was a popular dish at my table. I also had yuca fries which were my favorite.  Shrimp appetizer is yummy.  The chicken nachos were tasty. The drinks are good. Our waiter was knowledgeable and attentive.  Check this place out. It's easy to get to but parking will be hard just as a fyi.

Tasty foods🇪🇨 Ingredients were simple, plantains, potatoes and eggs and just so delicious and healthy! Lamb rice was perfect, meat was well cooked and tender, like the sauce very much! Of course Tres leches cake for a perfect ending. Good proportion for two people👌 Restaurant was cozy, has outdoor seats. The location wasn’t too far from a subway station, easy to access! Prices are lovely too.

Very cozy (small) restaurant serving excellent Ecuadorian dishes. Service was really friendly and if you are not familiar with this cuisine they were happy to explain and make recommendations. Expect to spend some extra time here waiting on your food as it's all made fresh and I suspect a small kitchen. We had about 45 minutes wait on lunch. However they have a nice drink selection to tide you over with reasonable prices on cocktails and beer.

The food is always so good and consistent here! I’ve been going here/getting take out for several years now. It seems they’ve done some rebranding and are trying to be a bit more upscale now. All of the food is $5-$10 more expensive than it used to be. Not a huge deal but a shame they’re making such delicious food less accessible!
Every part of our visit was a hit.  Every choice we made was authentic and delicious.  The Bolon was amazing. Definitely coming back.

Great place to checkout! Loved the vibe and the decor. The staff was friendly, music was good…only thing is that the DJ would switch genres so randomly but overall had a great time. Drinks were good, didn’t try the food but really fun place to go with friends! Would def recommend and go back!

Upon leaving the establishment the employees who check people in practically rushed me and my friend out when all we wanted to take a picture. Both my friend and I are Hispanic and I sort of felt there was special treatment with the white folks entering the establishment. The restaurant has a really nice the Mezcal made me do it sign outside and we wanted to take the picture there.
